## Building website using R, Markdown, and GitHub

The tutorial shows how to deploy a website, hosted on GitHub Pages for free, using R and Markdown.

> The tutorial is available as a written document: [link to tutorial](https://biplabendu.github.io/my_dummy_website/website_tutorial.html)

To make the process highly accessible, I have created a [dummy website](https://biplabendu.github.io/my_dummy_website) that provides a template for building a professional website with two pages: a homepage and a webpage for describing your research experience. The template can be customized by renaming and repurposing the individual pages.

## Plotting publication-quality figures using R 

This tutorial is intended to get you started with programming in R, using RStudio (Cloud) for working on a shared project (link provided [below](https://rstudio.cloud/project/1049250)). The code in the R script will generate high-quality plots using an example dataset, and save them to your local hard disk for use.

Shared project link: https://rstudio.cloud/project/1049250

Note: This tutorial was created for students taking PCB3044L-Principles of Ecology lab at UCF.
